timeline.message: Move character string to numeric conversion code to ValueStringBase
Optimize conversions to REAL and DOUBLE PRECISION
Restore YEAR data type for MySQL compatibility mode
Throw better exception for MERGE INTO without updatable columns

timeline.author: grandinj

replies.bodyText: It is what we expect and not what we found.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText:
Yes, we expect to "have at least one updateable column", but we did not find that.
So we should say
"Valid MERGE INTO statement requires at least one updatable column"
or
"MERGE INTO statement without at least one updatable column"
replies.author: grandinj

replies.bodyText:
The whole error message is:
Syntax error in SQL statement "MERGE INTO T0(C0) KEY(C1) VALUES (1)[*]"; expected "Valid MERGE INTO statement with at least one updatable column"
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: It don't want to allocate a new error code for the normal error message for this specific corner case in non-standard command. This command has significant design problems, it can't handle GENERATED ALWAYS identity columns and generated columns well.
replies.author: katzyn
